# landscapeImagePhone

**Instance Property**

The image to use to represent the item in landscape orientation when using the iPhone appearance idiom.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var landscapeImagePhone: UIImage? { get set }
```

## Discussion

This image can be used to create other images to represent this item on the bar—for example, a selected and unselected image may be derived from this image. You should set this property before adding the item to a bar. The default value is `nil`.

## Getting and setting properties

- **title**: The title displayed on the item.
- **image**: The image used to represent the item.
- **largeContentSizeImage**: The image to display for users who are blind or have low vision.
- **imageInsets**: The image inset or outset for each edge.
- **landscapeImagePhoneInsets**: The image inset or outset for each edge of the image in landscape orientation when using the iPhone appearance idiom.
- **largeContentSizeImageInsets**: The insets to apply to the bar item’s large image when displaying the image in an assistive UI.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value indicating whether the item is enabled.
- **tag**: The bar item’s tag, an app-supplied integer that you can use to identify bar item objects in your app.
